item.title: Whole of Bramble Croft and Valley Road needs cleaning, 2nd October
item.description:
Whole of Bramble Croft and Valley Road needs cleaning, lots of rubbish and takeaway boxes and bags are getting left in the street, pain of glass was smashed in the middle of the road o/s 42 Bramble Croft that hasn't been cleared up and cars keep driving over it - please can this be looked into
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bramble Croft, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light facing the wrong way, 2nd October
item.description:
The traffic light for the Avery Hill Road to Southwood Road approach (on the Southwood Road side) is facing the wrong direction, and cannot be seen by the intended traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Southwood Road, New Eltham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Fox poo everywhere outside school entrance, 2nd October
item.description:
There are 4 vulgar smelling fix diarrheas being walked and spread by children and families the smell is unbearable and it is disgusting to say the least. It has been there for over a week and getting worse as more foxes are adding to this issue. The school won't clean as it isn't their responsibility. Home owners don't seem to mind the smell

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Lane, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public has access to live parts on lighting column., 2nd October
item.description:
Cover panel to lighting column 1231/13 on corner of Webber St and Boyfield street has been removed leaving access to live parts, panel has been left on the floor. Column in question is located directly opposite Friars Primary foundation school. Unaware of how long the issue has been present but based on the condition of the cover this has been tapped previously, perhaps a replacement panel is required to prevent this from re occurring.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-24, Webber Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter along pathway, 2nd October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Queen's Road, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven paving, 2nd October
item.description:
The paving in this area has become really uneven I believe caused by tree roots. I have witnessed a number of young children including my own trip and fall and accidents with scooters and bikes with wheels becoming stuck in the gaps or loosing control over the uneven surface. I have also witnessed recently on two occasions two elderly residents also trip in this location causing injuries. The pathway leading from the corner of the road to bridge that crosses the stream has really become uneven causing a significant trip hazard Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 126, Berwick Crescent, Falconwood, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
